net.sf.gogui.game
Class Clock

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.gogui.game.Clock
All Implemented Interfaces:
ConstClock
public final class Clock
extends java.lang.Object
implements ConstClock

Time control for a Go game. If the clock is not initialized with Clock.setTimeSettings, the clock will count upwards, otherwise the time settings with main and/or byoyomi time are used. The time unit is milliseconds.

Nested Class Summary

          Listener to clock changes.
static class Clock.SystemTimeSource
          Time source using the system time.

          Provides the time for a clock.

getTimeString

public static java.lang.String getTimeString(double timeLeft,
                                             int movesLeft)
Format time left to a string. If movesLeft < 0, only the time will be returned, otherwise after the time string, a slash and the number of moves left will be appended.

getToMove

public GoColor getToMove()
Return color the clock is currently measuring the time for. Returns null, if clock is between a #stopMove and #startMove.

Specified by:
getToMove in interface ConstClock

parseTimeString

public static long parseTimeString(java.lang.String s)
Parses a time string. The expected format is [[H:]MM:]SS.

Returns:
The time in milliseconds or -1, if the time string is not valid.

reset

public void reset()

reset

public void reset(GoColor color)

resume

public void resume()
Resume clock, if it was halted during a player's move time.

setListener

public void setListener(Clock.Listener listener)
Register listener for clock changes. Only one listener supported at the moment. If the clock has a listener, the clock should be stopped with halt() if it is no longer used, otherwise the timer thread can keep an application from terminating.

setTimeSettings

public void setTimeSettings(TimeSettings settings)
Set time settings. Changing the time settings does not change the current state of the clock. The time settings are only used when the clock is reset or the next byoyomi period is initialized.

setTimeLeft

public void setTimeLeft(GoColor color,
                        long time,
                        int movesLeft)
Set time left.

Parameters:
color - Color to set the time for.
time - New value for time left.
movesLeft - -1, if not in byoyomi.

startMove

public void startMove(GoColor color)
Start time for a move. If the clock was already running, the passed time for the current move is discarded.

stopMove

public void stopMove()
Stop time for a move. If the clock was running, the time for the move is added to the total time for the color the clock was running for; otherwise this function does nothing.
